name: Allen H Miner
biography: Allen Harris Miner (October 18, 1917 â€“ January 4, 2004) was an American director and screenwriter. He served as a photographer during World War II. Miner then directed and wrote for television programs including Perry Mason, Mission: Impossible, The Twilight Zone, Route 66, The Lawless Years, Tales of Wells Fargo, Riverboat and Wagon Train. He died in January 2004 of natural causes in San Marcos, California, at the age of 86.
